newsitem.title: SPAIN: Copper price seen above $1.00/lb into next century.
newsitem.headline: Copper price seen above $1.00/lb into next century.

text.p: Copper prices may be set to stay above $1.00/lb into the next century as the growth of demand outpaces new supply side capacity, Javier Targhetta, president of Spanish producer Atlantic Copper, said.
An additional 200,000 tonnes a year of extra demand was coming from the Far East, and that trend may stretch through to 2005, Targhetta said at Metal Bulletin's 10th International Copper Conference.
Although CIS copper consumption of 250,000 tonnes was still just a quarter of what the Soviet Union recorded in the late 1980s, there were signs that an upturn in offtake might have started in 1996.

Despite new SX-EW (solvent extraction-electrowon) projects and other smelters and refineries, there did not appear to be enough new capacity to satisfy the more than likely increase in demand, he said.
"I clearly see them (prices) well above the $1.00/lb level rather then below that price for the coming four to five years," Targhetta said.
